content.title: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles
content.beneficiary: Wards and widows of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles personnel
content.details: The Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles is a scholarship scheme introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India from the academic year 2006-07 to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards & widows of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles (CAPFs & AR) Personnel.
benefits: Scholarship duration up to 5 years depending on the course
eligibility: Wards/widows of deceased CAPFs and Assam Rifles personnel who died in harness/election duty
Wards of personnel disabled due to causes attributable to Government service
Wards of Ex CAPFs & AR personnel in receipt of Gallantry Awards
Wards/widows of retired and serving CAPFs & AR Personnel (Personnel below Officer Rank)
Pursuing first professional degree programme in specified fields
Minimum of 60% marks in Minimum Entry Qualification (MEQ)
exclusions: Wards of civilian employees of CAPFs, AR, and States/UTs Police personnel
Applicants pursuing professional courses through correspondence/distance learning
Applicants availing the benefit of other scholarship schemes/getting stipend and financial assistance
Applicants already availed scholarship under PMSS
Applicants pursuing courses not leading to the award of a degree
Change of course/college by the Selected Student
content.application_process: Online submission for the scholarship can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal.
documents_required: Duly attested scanned copy of the Mark sheet MEQ
PPO/Discharge Certificate/Book for categories A to F
Disability Certificate for categories B & D
Death Certificate for categories A & C
Certificate of Gallantry award for category E

faqs.question: What is the 'Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles'?
faqs.answer: It is a scholarship scheme introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards & widows of CAPFs & AR Personnel.

faqs.question: How many scholarships are available under the scheme each year?
faqs.answer: A total of 2000 scholarships are awarded annually under the PMSS, with an equal allocation for both girls and boys.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits include a monthly scholarship amount of ₹3,000 for girls and ₹2,500 for boys.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is applicable for up to 5 years, depending on the duration of the course pursued by the applicant.

faqs.question: What happens if there is a shortfall in fresh scholarship recipients?
faqs.answer: If the number of fresh applicants selected is less than 1000, the shortfall will not be adjusted from the allocation for girls or boys.
